title.en: Oral and Written Translation into and from English
title.et: Inglise keele kirjalik ja suuline tõlge

faculty.address:
Tartu linn, 
Tartu linn, Tartumaa 
EST

course_main_structural_unit.address:
Raekoja plats 2
20307 Narva linn, 
Ida-Virumaa 
EST

description.en: The course looks at translation methods depending on the type of text and its purpose. It also introduces the latest trends in translation theory. The course teaches practical written and oral English translation into one's mother tongue and from the mother tongue into English. The texts are from various journalistic publications, as well as literary translation.
description.et: Kursus vaatleb tõlkimismeetodeid sõltuvalt teksti tüübist ja selle eesmärgist. Samuti tutvustatakse uusimaid suundi tõlketeoorias. Kursus õpetab praktilist kirjalikku ja suulist tõlget inglise keelest oma emakeelde ja emakeelest inglise keelde. Tekstid on erinevatest ajakirjanduslikest väljaannetest, samuti tutvutakse ilukirjandusliku tõlkega

objectives.en: 1) to teach the different ways and methods of translation in practice
objectives.et: 1) õpetada kasutama praktikas erinevad tõlkimise viise ja meetodeid.

objectives.en: 2) to teach students translation and interpretation into and from English.
objectives.et: 2) õpetada üliõpilastele kirjalikku ja suulist tõlget inglise keelest ja inglise keelde.

learning_outcomes.en: 1) is familiar with the basic theories of translation and their history and is able to compare them with one another;
learning_outcomes.et: 1) on teadlik põhitõlketeooriatest, nende ajaloost ja on võimeline neid omavahel võrrelda;

learning_outcomes.en: 2) distinguishes between grammatical and lexical translation difficulties and is able to solve them;
learning_outcomes.et: 2) eristab grammatilisi ja leksikaalseid tõlkeraskusi ja oskab neid lahendada;

learning_outcomes.en: 3) is aware of the peculiarities of different texts and their translation (eg, press texts);
learning_outcomes.et: 3) on teadlik erinevate tekstide ja nende tõlke omapärasustest (nt, ajakirjanduse tekstid);

learning_outcomes.en: 4) can translate from English into their mother tongue and from mother tongue to English, distinguishing between possible grammatical and lexical difficulties in translation.
learning_outcomes.et: 4) oskab tõlkida inglise keelest oma emakeelde ja emakeelest inglise keelde, eristades võimalikke grammatilisi ja leksikaalseid tõlkeraskusi.

independent_work.et: Course independent work assignments include translation exercises to practice translation procedures in accordance with the guidelines provided in lecture notes in Moodle

description.et:
Term tests on translation (individual/pair/group translation)
A- Source text comprehension, transfer of its meaning, choice of language means and stylistic devices allows to achieve an excellent correspondence of the source text to the target text
B- Source text comprehension, transfer of its meaning, choice of language means and stylistic devices allows to achieve a very good correspondence of the source text to the target text
C- Source text comprehension, transfer of its meaning, choice of language means and stylistic devices allows to achieve a good correspondence of the source text to the target text
D- Source text comprehension, transfer of its meaning, choice of language means and stylistic devices allows to achieve a poor correspondence of the source text to the target text
E- Source text comprehension, transfer of its meaning, choice of language means and stylistic devices allows to achieve a satisfactory correspondence of the source text to the target text

Term tests on translation theory
A- test questions are answered with maximum precision and reference to corresponding theoretical sources and are supported by references to the sample text
B- test questions are answered correctly and demonstrate very good knowledge of theoretical aspects and reference to the sample text.
C- test questions are answered with various degrees of precision and demonstrate good knowledge of theoretical aspects and are supported by references to the sample text
D- answers to test questions show the student's satisfactory knowledge of some theoretical aspects and do not have any support by example from the sample text
E- test answers demonstrate student's knowledge of some basic principles of translation analysis

A- the level of translation approximation is very high; choice of words and structures is thorough and highly adequate; no losses of meaning; full completion of the task
B- the level of translation approximation is high; choice of words and structures is highly adequate; some minor losses of meaning; full completion of the task
C- the level of translation approximation is medium; choice of words and structures is adequate; some losses of meaning; full completion of the task
D- the level of translation approximation is medium; choice of words and structures is satisfactory with stylistic inconsistency; numerous cases of losses of meaning; partial completion of the task
E- the level of translation approximation is low; choice of words and structures is poor with stylistic inconsistency; numerous cases of losses of meaning; partial completion of the task

grade_preconditions.et: To complete the course a course participant shall have all in-course assignments (translation practice) and tests (theory) assessed with positive grades.

grade_evaluation.et: The course finishes with a written examination which consists of two parts: 1) translation difficulties in sample sentences; 2) translation of a publicist text on a topic of general cultural interest.

debt_elimination.et: .The course participant has to account for each missed test /practice assignment paper within two weeks in accordance with the deadlines/cut-off dates set in Moodle.

assessment_scale.et: Eristav (A, B, C, D, E, F, mi)
assessment_scale.en: differentiated (A, B, C, D, E, F, not present)

resources.mandatory_materials:
1.Meshkov O., Lambert M. 2000. Learn to Translate by Translating. M.: NVI-TEZAURUS.
2..Newmark Peter 1988 Approaches to Translation .New York. London: Prentice Hall
resources.recommended_materials:
1.Mona Baker.1992 In other words. A coursebook on translation. London and new York. Routledge
2.Burak A 2002 Translating Culture Moscow: Valent
3. Roger T.Bell 1991 Translation and Translating. Theory and Practice, London, New York: Longman
